skt

Class SocketStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • skt.SocketStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class SocketStream
extends Object
implements Runnable
    The SocketInterface handles all communication between a Socket and a connected object.

    When sending a message to the Socket, the message ID and contents are added to a retry buffer. A buffer entry will remain in the retry buffer until:

    • the SocketInterface has received an acknowledgment from the recipient
    • the message has been resent after timeout ms, numRetries number of times, with no acknowledgment
    If the message was never acknowledged, the SocketInterface will send the message back to the calling class in the form: rejected <Message.contents>.

    The fields timeout and numRetries have default values of 1000 and 3, respectively.

    When the external Socket the SocketInterface is connected to is disconnected without warning, the SocketInterface will send the String "closed" to the data queue and close itself.

    Author:
    Kyle
    See Also:
    Socket

    • Constructor Detail

      • SocketStream

        public SocketStream(Socket skt)
             throws ConnectException
        Constructs a SocketStream object with a previously connected Socket.

        Use a BufferedSocketReader to read from this SocketStream.

        Parameters:
        skt - a previously connected Socket
        Throws:
        ConnectException - if skt is not already connected

      • SocketStream

        public SocketStream()
        Constructs a SocketStream object.

        Use a BufferedSocketReader to read from this SocketStream.

        Must call SocketStream.connect() before using this SocketStream.

    • Method Detail

        public void connect(String hostname,
           int port)
        Connect the SocketInterface to port port at hostname hostname.

        Also instantiates BufferedReader in and DataOutputStream out.

        Parameters:
        hostname - the desired hostname of the Socket
        port - the desired port of the Socket
